context: I was judgmental about your relationships
letters:
Dear [Daughter's Name],

I hope this note finds you well. Iâ€™ve been doing a lot of reflecting lately, and I felt it was important to reach out and express something that weighs heavily on my heart.

I want to sincerely apologize for the judgment I expressed regarding your relationships. I recognize that my words may have caused you pain or made you feel unsupported, and for that, I am truly sorry. It was never my intention to undermine the choices you make or to doubt your judgment. I realize now that my views were influenced by my own experiences and fears rather than by understanding and trust in you as an individual.

Your relationships are a part of your journey, and I should have shown you the respect and faith you deserve. You have grown into such a remarkable person, and I admire your ability to navigate this aspect of your life with courage and openness. I understand that love and connection can be complicated and that what matters most is your happiness.

I am committed to being more supportive and open-minded moving forward. Please know that I am here for you, and I want to listen and learn from you. You deserve a space where you can share your thoughts and experiences without fear of judgment.

Thank you for your patience and for loving me even when I stumble. I hope to rebuild your trust in me and continue to strengthen our bond. I love you more than words can convey, and I am so proud of the person you are becoming.

With all my love,

[Your Name]
